p: Safflower ( Carthamus tinctorius) has been used in food and traditional medicine due to its active compounds such as flavonoids, phenylethanoid glycosides, coumarins, fatty acids, and steroids to treat conditions such as dysmenorrhea, amenorrhea and other health issues ( 34). It has been shown that Safflower ( Carthamus tinctorius) petal extract exerts neuroprotective, antidepressant, and antianxiety activities ( 35, 36).
